overview: Featuring interviews with some of the leading voices of Southern music -- including JoJo Hermann and George McConnell of Widespread Panic, Cary Hudson of Blue Mountain and legendary producer Jim Dickinson -- this documentary reveals much about the Mississippi jam band Beanland, tracing its journey from a back-porch cover band to a bona fide musical force. Songs include "Take Me to the Show," "Dorothea," "Mr. Crooper" and "Swing Tune No. 9."
title: Beanland: Rising from the Riverbed
